recommendations: “Enterprises of all sizes come to me for LinkedIn marketing expertise, but when I needed to entrust the growth of my brand here on LinkedIn to someone, Shreya was the obvious choice. She was pleasant to work with, her content work performed fabulously, and I learned a great deal in the course of our engagement. I only ended our arrangement because I couldn't handle any more clients. I know people who charge 10x what she does for lower quality of work, too. Chat with her, you'll see what I mean (I get nothing for this recommendation and she doesn't even know I'm sending it right now)” Show less

“I worked with Shreya for almost two years as a writer, and it was an absolute pleasure - right from start to finish. She is amongst the most organized, forward-thinking, and creative people out there, and her credentials and reputation stand testament to that. While working with her, at no point did I ever feel like I was short of ideas, and if there was anything I wanted to discuss, she was always available. The projects she trusted me with were challenging enough for me to give my best, and yet they were easy enough that they could be completed on time. I'm sure amongst the thousands of recommendations she's received, mine is another feather in her overfilled cap. If you're looking for someone to set you up with the right content, no matter what that may be, I'd suggest Shreya's name in a heartbeat! I'm looking forward to seeing what she does, and I hope our paths cross one another soon again.” Show less

volunteer_experience.info:
Ranked in Top 50: #LinkedInCompassionAwardWho we are:- A group of 5 students in Ireland who have teamed up to change the world through compassion.What the problem is:- Homelessness is a huge crisis affecting 10,000+ people in IrelandWhat we do:- Link the homeless to home owners so that they may have a home- Provide up-skilling of the homeless so that they may find a good job.How we do it:- ‘Personal Profiling’- We create personal CV-like…
            

    
    

    
        Show more

          
    
  
      

        
          Ranked in Top 50: #LinkedInCompassionAwardWho we are:- A group of 5 students in Ireland who have teamed up to change the world through compassion.What the problem is:- Homelessness is a huge crisis affecting 10,000+ people in IrelandWhat we do:- Link the homeless to home owners so that they may have a home- Provide up-skilling of the homeless so that they may find a good job.How we do it:- ‘Personal Profiling’- We create personal CV-like profiles of the homeless individuals and home owners. We use AI and tech to match, train and upscale skills in the homeless, and then match these trained people to people with homes.Why we do it:- A roof over the head is the most basic possession one needs. Once this basic need is fulfilled, the individual can pursue their dream, while also focusing on improving themselves and striving to do better every day. We‘re helping the homeless change their lives!If you’d like to fund us, please message.
            

    
    

    
        Show less
volunteer_experience.subtitle: ‘HomeLink’
volunteer_experience.title: Co-Founder

volunteer_experience.info:
I volunteered with VTP to help school students with their homework. As a tutor, I focused on explaining the concept to the students, and allowing the students to solve the questions by themselves. Instead of providing the answers with an aim to complete the homework, I ensured that the students gained a clear understanding of the topic, and are capable of solving the questions by themselves. I tutored a 6th grade student for Mathematics. The main concepts included factors, algebra…
            

    
    

    
        Show more

          
    
  
      

        
          I volunteered with VTP to help school students with their homework. As a tutor, I focused on explaining the concept to the students, and allowing the students to solve the questions by themselves. Instead of providing the answers with an aim to complete the homework, I ensured that the students gained a clear understanding of the topic, and are capable of solving the questions by themselves. I tutored a 6th grade student for Mathematics. The main concepts included factors, algebra, trigonometry, geometry and statistics. I taught these topics by showing a complete step-by-step working of the mathematical problems, so that the student understood the procedure, and could also refer to these notes for future doubts.
            

    
    

    
        Show less
volunteer_experience.subtitle: Voluntary Tuition Programme
volunteer_experience.title: Mathematics Tutor

volunteer_experience.info: I conducted an Impact Assessment for Divya Vidyalay, a school for differently-abled tribal students. I stayed at the school for a week to study and understand the teaching techniques, activities, examination patterns and students' learning abilities.
volunteer_experience.subtitle: Divya Vidyalay Jawhar
volunteer_experience.title: Impact Assessment Study

publications: [{"title":"Ca$hing In on LinkedIn: Building a LinkedIn audience that generates 3-5 inbound leads a day and 6 figure$ a year","subtitle":"Self","date":"October 25, 2021","description":"700+ digital copies sold"},{"title":"Freelancing Freedom: From Caged Ideas to Your First Client [and more] in 10 Days","subtitle":"Self","date":"July 4, 2021","description":"1000+ digital copies sold"},{"title":"Money Call$: Prospect Conversation Systems I Used To Go From Broke Student To Closing $5000+ Deals On The Phone","subtitle":"Self","date":"March 23, 2021","description":"400+ digital copies sold"},{"title":"How I Became A Doctor... of Words!","subtitle":"edumilestones.com","date":"July 5, 2019","description":"[This story won First Place in the #MyCareerStory contest and was originally published on edumilestones.com]It took me 2 years of a terrible high school experience to realise how much I loved writing.I needed a few months of internships after college to find out what kind of writing I love.It took me another few months of even more internships to find out I was actually good at the kind of writing I loved.And today, I am in love with who I am and what I do.Just because I chose my own career.I've had a topsy-turvy ride, and I discovered what I loved: Content Writing.Hope you have a topsy-turvy ride, only to end up discovering what YOU love!It's a long story... but it's only just begun! :)"},{"title":"[EXPERT OPINION]: 10 things you should know before starting out as a Content Writer","subtitle":"CoFoundersTown.com","date":"June 19, 2019"},{"title":"Important Lessons Every Young Entrepreneur Must Learn from Taylor Swift","subtitle":"knowlab.in","date":"May 23, 2019","description":"Whatever be your opinion of Taylor Swift, you can’t deny the staggering numbers she has achieved. These 3 attributes are what helped Taylor Swift get where she is now. Read on to know how she did it!"},{"title":"Maleficent and Me: Arguments!","subtitle":"Verbys","date":"Feb 2019","description":"This article is a fun, comical, satirical take on the nature of my arguments. It is a creative piece, one which is unlike anything I have written before. Read on to find out how my arguments compare to Maleficent, the Mistress of All Evil!"},{"title":"Compassion and Empathy in Business Leadership- Lessons from the CEO of LinkedIn Jeff Weiner","subtitle":"buildandbalance.com","date":"October 25, 2018"},{"title":"Introduction to Design Thinking","subtitle":"Trinity Entrepreneurial Society","date":"October 24, 2018"}]
